The Wildcats won their first [[Rose Bowl Game|Rose Bowl]] in school history.
==Season== Northwestern finished the season with an 8-2 record, losing only to perennial powerhouses [[1948 Michigan Wolverines football team|Michigan]], 28-0, and [[Notre Dame Fighting Irish football|Notre Dame]], 17-12.<ref name="Archives">{{cite web|url=http://www.library.northwestern.edu/archives/exhibits/football/6.html |title=A History of Football at Northwestern: Bob Voights: 1947-1954 |publisher=Northwestern University Archives |accessdate=2008-07-17}}</ref> Northwestern blanked [[UCLA Bruins football|UCLA]], 19â0, [[Purdue Boilermakers football|Purdue]], 21â0, and [[Syracuse Orange football|Syracuse]], 48â0. NU rallied from three turnovers and a 16 point deficit to defeat [[Minnesota Golden Gophers football|Minnesota]], 19â16, and beat [[Ohio State Buckeyes football|Ohio State]], 21â7, [[Wisconsin Badgers football|Wisconsin]], 16â7, and [[Illinois Fighting Illini football|Illinois]], 20â7.<ref name="Archives"/> [[Big Ten Conference|Big Nine Conference]] rules prevented conference champion Michigan from making a successive trip to face the Rose Bowl, so second-place Northwestern won the bid instead.
